derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'affected by black bile', one of the four supposed cardinal humours of the body, believed to cause melancholy): from Latin atra bilis 'black bile', translation of Greek melankholia 'melancholy', + -ious

means.word_mean: 1. irritable as if suffering from indigestion
